page.title: 15Changing Times, Snape,Yorks.
page.content: The retired Headmistress is 71 and has lived in Snape all her life. She has noticed many changes in the village. People now have electricity in their homes, more people have a telephone and radios have replaced gramophones.Roads were rough and stony and not smooth as they are today.There were no cars,tractors or motor-driven machinery.People walked to and from Bedale,travelled by bicycle, horse and cart or on a wagonette.Today most people travel by car or bus.There are more people and houses in Snape now than when she was young.Nowadays farmers employ fewer men because they have tractors and farming equipment.
